item.title: Answer me, please[treetimer not going above 1]
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

For some reason, every time I post about my woodcutting, it gets ignored and sent back pages. My problem:
My treetimer WILL NOT go above 1. I have run tests, and it does not go above 1.

case 1281: if(playerLevel[8] > 14) if(playerHasItem(1351) || (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1351)) { setAnimation(879); addItem(1521, 1); addSkillXP(2000, 8); sendMessage("You get some oak logs."); treetimer ++; } else { sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!"); } else { if(playerLevel[8] < 15) sendMessage("You need 15 woodcutting to cut oaks."); } if (treetimer == 1) { ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1356, 0, 10); } break;
That works, because the stump replaces the tree. BUT, if I have treetimer == 2, nothing happens. It wonâ€™t go above 1. Wtf?

Nothing wrong with treetimer, it works in 2 other cases.

If you help, thanks.

Need a better explain, ask.

Read full topic
item.source: Answer me, please[treetimer not going above 1]
